roleset.name: cast a ballot

role.descr: numerical count of vote, margin, down/up
electorate for whom arg0 is a proxy voter

example.name: vote on an issue
example.text: NRM said it expects unitholders to vote on the restructuring at a meeting Dec. 15.

example.name: vote for a candidate
example.text: ``I guess we'll reluctantly go ahead and do it, vote for Dinkins,'' says Richard Wade, a politically active professor who supported Richard Ravitch, an also-ran in the Democratic primary.

example.name: arg1 as infinitive
example.text: Nekoosa's poison pill allows shareholders to vote to rescind it...

example.name: voting shares
example.text: The statement emphasized that holders representing 75% of the shares voting at a special shareholders' meeting must agree to lift the takeover restrictions.

example.name: proxy voting
example.text: ``Thank God we have some deal on the table,'' said Stewart Gilchrist, a director at Scottish Amicable Investment Managers, which *trace*-1 intends *trace*-1 to vote its roughly 1% stake in favor of the restructuring.

example.name: with outcome of vote
example.text: [The Peugeot metalworkers]-1 began filing out of the shop, which makes auto parts, at the plant in Mulhouse after [*]-1 voting 589 to 193 [*-3] to abandon the occupation.

example.name: Voters and voted-on
example.text: The union vote to reject the proposed pact was 230-215 .

example.name: Interesting arg 2
example.text: He had enough votes to block the maneuver on procedural grounds ,perhaps as soon as today
example.arg: to block the maneuver on procedural grounds

example.name: With locative
example.text: They will put this question to a vote in the Senate.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG0
example.text: It is said that the two biggest causes of family arguments this year have been differences over who to vote for in the presidential election , and over what stocks to buy .

example.name: With manner of voting
example.text: They held a straw vote over who should go and fetch the Chinese takeout.
example.arg: over who should go and fetch the Chinese takeout.

example.name: TMP
example.text: Romney could be left hobbling after Super Tuesday and early voting has already started .

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: She said his voting for the bill amounted to a "conflict of interest."

roleset.note: VOTE-V NOTES: VerbNet class dub-29.3. (from vote.01-v)
VOTE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry vote.01, OntoNotes sense grouping vote.01; maps to VN class dub-29.3. Framed by Claire. (from vote.01-n)
VOTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, vote-v.01, vote-n.01. Corresponds to VNcls dub-29.3. (from voting.01-n)

roleset.name: give via legislative process

example.name: graft
example.text: United's directors voted themselves, and their spouses, lifetime access to the Friendly Skies -- free first-class travel, and $20,000 a year for life as well.
example.arg: lifetime access to the Friendly Skies -- free first-class travel, and $20,000 a year for life as well.

roleset.note: VOTE-V NOTES: Verbnet entries future_having-13.3 get-13.5.1, other framed members include allocate, concede, grant; catch, entitle, extend, hire, lease, pick, reserve, seize. (from vote.02-v)

example.name: die die die!
example.text: THE HOUSE votes down a proposal to put pension plans under the control of joint labor-management boards.
example.arg: a proposal to put pension plans under the control of joint labor-management boards.
